description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Aatrox''' periodically empowers his next basic attack to gain {{sti|range|50 '''bonus''' range}} and deal {{as|{{pp|key=%|5 to 12}} of the target's '''maximum''' health}} as {{tip|physical damage|{{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}}} [[on-hit]], capped at 100 against monsters, and {{tip|heal|healing}} him for the {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} dealt.

''Deathbringer Stance's'' {{sti|cooldown}} is reduced by 2 seconds whenever '''Aatrox''' hits a champion or large monster with a basic attack or an ability, doubled if he hits with the edge of {{ai|The Darkin Blade|Aatrox}}. The cooldown reduction for {{ai|The Darkin Blade|Aatrox}} applies only once and prioritizes for the unit hit by the edge.
i1.name: Deathbringer Stance
notes: * '''Aatrox''' will assume stance when an enemy champion is in range of {{ai|Infernal Chains|Aatrox}}.
* The empowered attack is given [[on-attack]]. Commanding an attack before ''Deathbringer Stance'' is avaiable, but hitting the target while it's available will not trigger the bonus damage.

description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Aatrox''' swings his greatsword in the target direction, striking enemies in a line. ''The Darkin Blade'' can then be reactivated twice within 4 seconds, with each cast refreshing the timer. The second cast strikes enemies in a cone and the third in the target area. There's a 1 second cooldown between each cast.
Each strike deals {{as|physical damage}}, with {{tip|minions}} taking {{pp|key=%|50 to 0}} reduced damage. All units take 25% increased damage on the second cast and 50% on the third.

Hitting enemies at the far end of the first two casts and the center of the third deals 50% '''bonus''' damage and {{tip|airborne|knocks up}} enemies for {{fd|0.25}} seconds, doubled to {{fd|0.5}} seconds against {{tip|monsters}}.
leveling: {{st|First Swing Damage|{{ap|{{#var:b1}} to {{#var:b2}}}} {{as|(+ {{ap|{{#var:r1}} to {{#var:r2}}}}% AD)}}|Second Swing Damage|{{ap|{{#var:b1}}*1.25 to {{#var:b2}}*1.25}} {{as|(+ {{ap|{{#var:r1}}*1.25 to {{#var:r2}}*1.25}}% AD)}}|Third Swing Damage|{{ap|{{#var:b1}}*1.5 to {{#var:b2}}*1.5}} {{as|(+ {{ap|{{#var:r1}}*1.5 to {{#var:r2}}*1.5}}% AD)}}}}
notes: * Each cast of the ''The Darkin Blade'' has a small channel time, during which '''Aatrox''' cannot move and cast abilities, except for {{ai|Umbral Dash|Aatrox}} and {{si|Flash}}.
q1.target_range: {{tt|650|First cast}} / {{tt|525|Second cast}} / {{tt|200|Third cast center}} / {{tt|120|Empowered range offset}}

description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Aatrox''' smashes the ground in the target direction, creating a chain that stops on the first enemy hit, dealing {{as|physical damage}}, doubled against {{tip|minions}}, and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 25% for {{fd|1.5}} seconds.

If ''Infernal Chains'' hits a {{tip|champion}} or large monster, they are chained to the impact area. If the chained enemy is still in the impact area after {{fd|1.5}} seconds, they are {{tip|airborne|dragged}} to the center and take the same damage again.
leveling: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|30 to 70}} {{as|(+ 40% AD)}}|Minion Damage|{{ap|30*2 to 70*2}} {{as|(+ 80% AD)}}}}
w1.name: Infernal Chains

description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Aatrox''' {{tip|heals}} for a percentage of the non-periodic {{tt|damage|Post-mitigation}} he deals against champions.
''Umbral Dash'' resets '''Aatrox's''' basic attack timer and can be cast during his other spell casts without interruption.
e1.name: Umbral Dash

r1.blurb: Aatrox unleashes his demonic form, gaining attack damage and movement speed.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Aatrox''' unleashes his true demonic form for 10 seconds, {{tip|fear|fearing}} nearby enemy {{tip|minions}} for 3 seconds, and gaining {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}}, decaying over the duration.
While transformed '''Aatrox''' gains increased size and {{as|'''bonus''' attack damage}}, and receives increased {{tip|heal|self-healing}}.
With each enemy champion takedown, ''World Ender'' is extended by 5 seconds, refreshing its effects, up to the original amount.
r1.name: World Ender
notes: * His resource bar indicates the remaining duration of ''World Ender'', and it turns red after a champion takedown.
